p: Of the major compounds in thyme, the content of thymol in Thymus zygis and Thymus vulgaris amounts to 22.3â€“43.3%and 38.1 %, respectively. In addition, carvacrol accounts for 2.3%, along with other prevailing compounds such as p-cymene (29.1%), g-terpinene (5.2%) and linalool (3.7%) [ 19]. The chemical composition of the tested thyme is shown in Table 1.
